availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, tanner. Native of England. Son of John Currey and Dinah Currey. Married to Cornelia C. Gaines Currey on March 13, 1854. Father of John K. Currey, Mariam D. Currey, Fred G. Currey, and Davis Lee Currey. Hemp manufacturer in Harrodsburg in 1850. Tanner in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 364A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 25.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 4.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, County Marriages, Film #000216815, p. 20.
